Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2010 09:22PM iHEARTu wrote: Hello. I don't mean to frighten you, I had a bloody discharge from only my left nipple and it was DCIS. Yes, insist on getting a biopsy.  Like Elamar, I'd want to know what that lump was. A sample of the tissue would seem to be most accurate for a correct diagnosis. Perhaps a second opinion would be in order, IMHO? I will be thinking of you. -c
Posts.Title: My MRI was negative!! heyjude62 elimar

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2010 11:34AM iHEARTu wrote: Sorry this is happening! Someone had asked about this on another forum and hadn't heard about Alloderm or what it was made of for that matter!! Then on Friday I noticed something different on one of my incisions sites and decided to going for the PS for them to take a look. The first thing the nurse asked was, "I see we used Alloderm on you'?, and my heart just sunk. They didn't see any signs if infection but I have to go back in on Monday to make sure. AlloDerm is a dermal graft/implant material made from donated skin!!!!! The moral of all these stories is ASK QUESTIONS! I was SHOCKED they used this. Not that I don't trust my PS, and I believe this product is the common practice, but it would have been nice to know this...but then again, did I...UGH..so much to know. GOOD LUCK!!! CAthy

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 07:55PM iHEARTu wrote: Kimmie4- come to think of it, my onco looked at me in amazment when I told him I was doing the BMX too! I apprecited his concern, and he said he wanted me to know my options. He was the only one who made me 2nd guess myself. Good luck!!!cathy
Posts.Title: Stage 0 options ambyrp Kimmie4

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2010 01:18PM - edited Feb 20, 2010 01:20PM by iHEARTu Hi lovemygarden, My mx was 1.5.20 and yes, the same thing happened to me. The first two weeks were relatively uneventful,l then I started to get the phantom feelings and the itchies started.  With the phantom feelings I thought my nipples were well, nipping out. Then the creepy crawlies started, I thought I was going to go crazy. Ice helped a bit to get the edge off and I used some heat too, just the edge off. I did take some alprazolam, which seemed to help some. I guess it works on the nervous system. You get those itchy feelings because the nerves are trying to regenerate and find their 'new' home. My PS encouraged me to rub and lightly massage by breasts to help the nerves, which has helped too. I wore a cashmere zip up sweater alone and opened it up when I started to get that feeling. It REALLY does get better. I'm 5 weeks out and now it only occasionally happens if I wear something too tight or the seams of my shirt are too rough. Good luck, and take it easy. I'm learning the hard way by not resting. My PS gave me a verbal whooping that I'm doing too much...so take a nap when you get a chance:) (((H U G S))) Cathy
Posts.Title: BMX, discomfort just starting 2 weeks out? lovemygarden lovemygarden

Posts.Content: Mar 18, 2010 02:08PM iHEARTu wrote: These were some of my Pros and Cons, I'm sure there are more, but off the top of my head... Cons -No feeling (arousal) -Long recovery -Not real breasts -Double the itchies while nerve endings were healing, plus just the double of everything Pros -Less breast tissue to worry about. I'm a bit of a worry wart and would worry about the 5 to 10 reocurrance percent risk rate. Plus I'm 40, so it's relatively younger to be diagnosed, and you even younger -Perky girls if you decide to reconstruct -No bra if you choose to do so -Symmetry -No rads or chemo, although I would have had to have a single mastectomy because my area was pretty large, 10+ cm -No Prosthesis Good article www.cbsnews.com/stories/2002/0... I NEVER looked back! Good luck on your decision! -Cathy

Posts.Title: Brown blemishes around incisions...? iHEARTu RegulJ

Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 09:00PM iHEARTu wrote: I went to see the BS and she said all of my breast tissue was removed, so it couldn't be a fibrocystic cyst. The cyst is about where the nipple would have been. The BS did an ultrasound and said it was in my muscle and all looked fine and nothing to worry about. She thought it was a small sernoma (sp?) and PS wasn't concerned. If the lump would have been on my BC side I would have freaked, but all is well. Hope that helps? -catherine
